Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulation

  • public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Anders Alander Creates a simulation of a store with given parameters. This object collects statistics of the simulation, determines when to open new registers, send new customers to the store and is able to print statistics with its toString method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulation(int numberOfRegisters, int intensity, int maxGroceries, int thresholdForNewRegister)
      Creates a Store object from parameters read from config.propertis if such a file is found.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(int numberOfRegisters,
          int intensity,
          int maxGroceries,
          int thresholdForNewRegister)
        Creates a Store object from parameters read from config.propertis if such a file is found. Otherwise default values are chosen. Also sets how long to simulate for.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        A time step happens in the store that is simulated. Spawn chance of a new customer and its groceries is rolled and if one spawns it is sent to the store. The average queue length is measured and if it reaches a threshold a new register is opened in the store.

      • getAverageWaitTime

        public int getAverageWaitTime()
        Returns:
        It returns the average wait time of done customers in the store so far. If no customer in the store is done so far it returns 0.

      • getMaxWaitTime

        public int getMaxWaitTime()
        Returns:
        It returns the longest time any customer in the store has been waiting so far.

      • getTotalGroc

        public int getTotalGroc()
        Returns:
        Returns the total amount of registered groceries in the simulation so far

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        (non-Javadoc)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
